intro: Sida rubra, commonly known as scarlet bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender stems, opposite leaves, and small, clustered pink or red flowers. It typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. Sida rubra is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support pollinators.
